item.title: Introduction and Demonstration to Git Rebase
item.author: Author
item.description: Git rebase is a powerful command that lets us reapply commits on top of another commit or branch. It is a very useful command for both collaborating with others and developing our own project. We all know it is a good practice to keep a commit within reasonable size and readable for either code review or for later reference. However, as a developer myself, I often make mistakes when I am too focus on the coding flow to pay attention to follow displine.
